author: John Cross
title: Chelsea face having to pay Real Madrid transfer target Thibaut Courtois OVER £200,000-a-week to sign new deal
text:
Courtois is now the keeper Real want most after previous interest in Man United's David De Gea (Photo: Reuters) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Chelsea will have to give Thibaut Courtois a contract worth more than £200,000-a-week to keep him out of Real Madrid’s clutches. 
Keeper Courtois has emerged as European champions Real’s top summer target at his position. 
The Spanish side are desperate to sign a new No.1 and have also been looking at Manchester United's David de Gea, but they believe Courtois could be tempted back to Spain having previously spent THREE seasons on loan from Chelsea to Atletico Madrid. Chelsea signed Courtois in 2011, then sent him to Atletico on three season-long loans (Photo: Getty) Read More Chelsea old boy Ramires scores top-corner beauty in Asia's Champions League 
Manager Antonio Conte has made no secret of his determination to keep the Belgium international, whose current deal expires in 2019, so the champions-elect will have to step up negotiations. 
Courtois will know he is in demand and Chelsea face a major battle to persuade him to sign a new contract.
